## import the libraries

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(SimDesign)
```
## Import the data

```{r}
data <- read_excel("C:\\Users\\AkshayT\\Desktop\\dataset\\Netflix_titles\\netflix_titles.xlsx", sheet = "netflix_titles")
```



## Methods to see data

```{r}
head(data)
```

```{r}
skimr::skim_without_charts(data)
```

```{r}
str(data)
```

```{r}
glimpse(data)
```

## Replacing NA with 99 in duration_minutes column 

```{r}
mean(data$duration_minutes,na.rm = TRUE)
```

```{r}
data$duration_minutes[is.na(data$duration_minutes)] <- 99
```

```{r}
data$duration_minutes[is.na(data$duration_minutes)]
```

```{r}
glimpse(data)
```

## count() function is similar to value_count() in pandas

```{r}
count(data, duration_seasons, sort = TRUE)
```

## filtering out data with duration_seasons in c(42825,80188902)

```{r}
data <- filter(data, !data$duration_seasons %in% c(42825,80188902))
```

## check data again for count()

```{r}
count(data, duration_seasons, sort = TRUE)
```

## replace all NA in duration_season with 1 as they are movies

```{r}
data$duration_seasons[is.na(data$duration_seasons)] <- 1
```

## check data again for count()

```{r}
count(data, duration_seasons, sort = TRUE)

skimr::skim_without_charts(data)
```

## removing rows with no rating  (NA)

```{r}
data <- filter(data, !is.na(data$rating))
```

## removing rows with no description using filter() and assigning it to the dataframe

```{r}
data <- filter(data, !is.na(data$description))
```

## check

```{r}
skimr::skim_without_charts(data)
```

## removing rows without show_id (NA) by using filter() function ans assigning it to df

```{r}
data <- filter(data, !is.na(data$show_id))
```

## removing rows without date_added (NA) by using filter() function ans assigning it to df

```{r}
data <- filter(data, !is.na(data$date_added))
```


## check

```{r}
skimr::skim_without_charts(data)
str(data)
glimpse(data)
```

## ggplot

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x=release_year, y=duration_minutes, color=type))+
  geom_point()
```



```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x=release_year, y=duration_minutes, color=duration_minutes))+
  geom_point()+
  labs(title = "Duration minutes vs Release Year")
```



```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x=release_year, y=duration_minutes, color=release_year))+
  geom_point()+
  labs(title = "Duration minutes vs Release Year")+
  facet_wrap(~type)
```
